text:
Travel between Rwanda and Uganda becomes hassle free
As one of the measures taken to improve the flow of goods and visitors, the new Mirama Hills was handed over to the border, security, and customs agencies during the week from Rwanda and Uganda. Mirama Hills is a one-stop border post between Rwanda and Uganda. It is one of now 13 in the East African region.
Funded by Trade Mark East Africa, this measure encourages additional travel activities by cutting down on red tape and unnecessary bureaucracy when crossing the border.
Citizens of Uganda and Rwanda can travel from one country to the other using ID cards.
Road developments on both sides of the border linking Uganda and Rwanda have also taken place. Buses are used by many people to travel between the two countries.
Mirama Hills is the nearest border crossing between the two countries for travelers coming from Uganda.
